What? (on)
Updating a group in our Forgerock via AM doesn't replicate it through to the IDM managed groups.

h4. Steps to Reproduce? (i)
Update the membership of a group in AM.

h4. Expected Results (y)
The IDM managed group is also updated.

h4. Actual Results (n)
The IDM managed groups does not update.

The reconciliation process throughs an error.

Thomas","active":true,"timeZone":"Australia/Sydney"},"body":"Setup my local workstation with minikubes and installed ArgoCD.

Cloned our agliedigital-forgeops-deployment repo in stash and hooked my local argo up to it so I can upgrading the version without impacting on the main deployment.

Have a partially deployed forgerock on my localmachine, but was delayed by skaffold and kustomise problems injecting the ds image tags. Have manually added them in argocd to at least get the init containers run.

Need to finish getting the existing forgerock application stood up and then try pulling the changes in from upstream.","updateAuthor":{"self":"https://jira.agiledigital.com.au/rest/api/2/user?username=althomas","name":"althomas","key":"JIRAUSER18600","emailAddress":"althomas@agiledigital.com.au","avatarUrls":{"48x48":"https://jira.agiledigital.com.au/secure/useravatar?avatarId=10212","24x24":"https://jira.agiledigital.com.au/secure/useravatar?size=small&avatarId=10212","16x16":"https://jira.agiledigital.com.au/secure/useravatar?size=xsmall&avatarId=10212","32x32":"https://jira.agiledigital.com.au/secure/useravatar?size=medium&avatarId=10212"},"displayName":"Adam Thomas","active":true,"timeZone":"Australia/Sydney"},"created":"2022-07-08T17:39:25.132+1000","updated":"2022-07-08T17:39:25.132+1000"},{"self":"https://jira.agiledigital.com.au/rest/api/2/issue/128575/comment/239608","id":"239608","author":{"self":"https://jira.agiledigital.com.au/rest/api/2/user?username=althomas","name":"althomas","key":"JIRAUSER18600","emailAddress":"althomas@agiledigital.com.au","avatarUrls":{"48x48":"https://jira.agiledigital.com.au/secure/useravatar?avatarId=10212","24x24":"https://jira.agiledigital.com.au/secure/useravatar?size=small&avatarId=10212","16x16":"https://jira.agiledigital.com.au/secure/useravatar?size=xsmall&avatarId=10212","32x32":"https://jira.agiledigital.com.au/secure/useravatar?size=medium&avatarId=10212"},"displayName":"Adam Thomas","active":true,"timeZone":"Australia/Sydney"},"body":"I got my local instance of forgerock up and running on the version we have deployed, and then upgraded the images using the 7.2 base images.

I had to set the AM_STORES_USER_PASSWORD using the AM admin-ui to get my install working. I don't know why the correct password wasn't picked up from the environment. I also don't know if that will be required during our upgrade; it worked without re-setting it after the upgrade.

One thing we'll have to keep in mind is that the new CRDs make the {code}directoryInstance{code} key on the snapshots object mandatory, so that will need to be configured in the agiledigital profile in ds-cts.yaml and ds-idrepo.yaml.

There's a simple merge to get our current deployment branch up to the 7.2.0 tag and add those two parameters. It should be possible to make the changes, build the images and push them in to the right repos in about an hour. Then it should only need 15 minutes out of hours to do the upgrade.

 # branch the {{forgeops}} repo off {{feature/ADE-574-change-forgerock-to-use-new-cdm-deployment}} to {{main}}
 # branch off {{main}} to {{feature/ADE-1094-upgrade-to-7_2_0}}
 # merge {{origin/release/7.2.0}} in to the feature branch
 # uncomment the (now required) {{directoryInstance: 0}} statement in the {{kustomize/base/ds*/ds*.yaml}} files
 # update the readme to point to the 7.2.0 release and doco
 # push my feature branch up to stash and create a PR in to {{main}}
 # ping the channel/Sam for a review
 # respond to any comments
 # pull down the main branch, run the skaffold build and render steps

{code:java}
skaffold build --default-repo=882107865787.dkr.ecr.ap-southeast-2.amazonaws.com/forgerock --output="../agile-forgeops-deployment/forgerock/deployment.yaml" --profile=agiledigital
skaffold render --default-repo=882107865787.dkr.ecr.ap-southeast-2.amazonaws.com/forgerock --output="../agile-forgeops-deployment/forgerock/deployment.yaml" --profile=agiledigital{code}

 # after hours, merge my feature branch on {{agile-forgeops-deployment}} to master

The same didn't work for Azure, we had to deleting and re-create the Azure Circle of Trust.

I suspect it was due to stale cache entries in the SAML2MetaCache. After turning up the verbosity of the logging we got a lot of entries around the errors listed above which mention that cache.

h4. Outcome (i)
Detail what outputs will come from the task when it's "done" (this statement is best in "S.M.A.R.T." format i.e.,: "Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound").
Both laptops wiped and back in white cupboard ready for use.

# Open [Endpoint|https://endpoint.microsoft.com/#home].
# Go to *Devices* > *All devices*.
# Search for the serial tag "H6HF5S2" and press Enter.
# Click the device name.
# Click *Wipe* and select the default options to wipe the device (device must be left on indefinitely).
# Repeat above steps for ST 41Z7QV2.

They are:
* A01288 (ST: H6HF5S2) and
* A01297 (ST: 41Z7QV2).

h4. Outcome (i)

# Click the device name.
# Click *Wipe* and select the default options to wipe the device (device must be left on indefinitely).
# Repeat above steps for ST 41Z7QV2.

To map AWS expenses to hosted applications.

Our AWS tenancies [Confluence documentation|https://wiki.agiledigital.com.au/display/ADE/Amazon+Web+Services+%28AWS%29+Cloud+Infrastructure] is updated with any 'new' learnings about all our active AWS accounts.

# Enumerate the Applications we host in AWS
# Map Applications to Account
# Map Applications to Confluence
# Where multiple applications run under the same account, divide by service

I think getting finer grained reporting on costs by application from here would be best done by applying [Cost Allocation Tags|https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awsaccountbilling/latest/aboutv2/cost-alloc-tags.html] to each of the independent resources where possible (EC2 instances, EBS volumes and snapshots etc).

{code:sh}
kubectl get crd | grep elastic | cut -f1 -d' ' | xargs kubectl delete crd
kubectl apply -f [https://download.elastic.co/downloads/eck/1.7.1/operator.yaml]
kubectl delete pod elastic-operator-0 -n elastic-system
{code}

elastic-operator-0   1/1     Running   0          5m21s
